CatDescriptText: Josie Katz, 981 Greenfield Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think children should be given 'allowances' (money)? If so, for what reason or reasons (just to have spending money or for chores done around the home, etc.)?  Do you think that it helps or hinders the development of the youngster?" answer reads: "Yes, definitely.  However, it should not be given for work done.  The kids should know what work there is to be done at the house and do it without any thought of compensation.  The allowance should be given to keep them from nagging.  The money will teach them budgeting."
TitMainTitle: Two women, including Josie Katz wearing dark leopard print jacquard suit, standing in front of C.C. Mellor, Smithfield Street, Downtown
